title: Stacking Context
description: The Stacking Context in CSS is a concept that defines a hierarchical layer system used to determine the stacking order of elements on the z-axis.
content: The concept that defines a hierarchical layer system used to determine the stacking order of elements on the z-axis. It's created by certain properties like `z-index`, `opacity` and `position` and it controls how elements overlap, ensuring proper visual hierarchy and clarity in a layout.
